isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS INTERNATIONAL PS125-9A, PS140-9A, PSO125-9A, PSO140-9A AND PSO150-9A - GENERAL INFORMATION - FILTER REGULATOR

para.emph: Refer to Figure 6for numbers in parentheses.

note.para: The 9 speed uses a filter regulator preset at 50-55 lbs. Use only petroleum-based solvents to clean parts. Blow air through the filter (inside to outside) to dislodge surface contaminants. Do not disassemble regulator section (9): it is not field repairable.

step1.para: Clean or replace filter element (7) every six months to one year whenever slow shifting is encountered. Element should be replaced after three cleanings. If regulator malfunction is indicated, replace entire unit.

To service filter section,shut off air pressure. Unscrew bowl (1) and remove O-ring (2). Unscrew stud (4). Remove louver (5), upper gasket (6), element (7), and lower gasket (8) from stud. Do not disassemble regulator section (9).
After cleaning inspect parts carefully; replace any damaged parts.
Reassemble by installing element (7) on stud (4) so that large end of internal taper (thinnest wall section) is toward hex on stud. Torque stud to 5-10 in-lbs.

Apply a wipe coat of Dow Corning DC7 Silicone Grease (or equivalent) to O-ring (2) seating surfaces on regulator (9) and bowl (1). Apply a light, even coat of Molykote "G" (or equivalent) to bowl threads. Torque bowl to 5-10 lbs. inch. If drain valve (3) was removed re-install and torque to 10-15 in-lbs.
